body.p: The files listed below are sample learning stacks to get you started. rigt-click the files and save them to your local drive. Then open them from within DingsBums?!.

tr.td: Very basic setup with syllables highlighting and only default entry type, unit, category etc.
The countries of the European Union as of the 1st of April 2004
Extensive use of type and global attributes, but only one entry type. Makes extensive use of the possibility to define labels per field.

Uses different entry types per word category (verbs, nouns etc.), each having one or more entry type attributes. Has a learning history to test statistics. This learning stack exemplifies how the software can be adapted to a specific need, in this example the Danish grammar. Also the level of detail chosen is for a highschool student. The same vocabulary for undergraduates or to prepare for a single trip to Denmark would use much less details - probably only the actual German words with the Dansih translation and no grammatical details.
